title: unfair  riot support team
body:
to whom this may concern
with certain problems in this world I feel like that the support team is really lazy in some aspects and will just shut you down in answering questions I believe that the customer should have a chance to ask as much questions as they can without getting shut off by anyone in the support team I also believe that in some aspect that the report system is a little unfair that it is directed on the most reports in the team and not looking at the whole conversation. It would be nice for all chat to be properly looked at instead of just assuming by what's on one side of the problem.

I would like an answer from someone that would be nice enough to acknowledge this to not tell me off.
{{sticker:fiora-cool}}

replies.body:
Actually, all it takes is one report in order to trigger a review of a person's logs. If a player is being toxic or negative to another player, then the system may act upon that player; however, if the other player decides to retaliate with words of their own, then the system may act upon both players. This is the reason why if someone tries to drag you into something that extends beyond a respectful disagreement, you should take a step back and evaluate whether things are getting too heated. 

For more context on reports and the Instant Feedback System, check out the resources below:

http://oce.leagueoflegends.com/en/news/game-updates/player-behavior/reports-how-do-they-work
https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/207489286-Instant-Feedback-System-FAQ-

I see

 thank you very much I appreciate the help I am sorry for the chaos that I have caused.

would you be nice enough to take my next ticket away because I got one waiting.
 I can now leave knowing that I understand the whole situation. I appreciate it.

{{sticker:slayer-jinx-catface}}

You're welcome :) If you have any player behaviour related questions or concerns in the future, you can always feel free to post them in the [Player Behaviour](http://boards.oce.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/player-behaviour) sub-boards.

Cheers!
